comments.body: PR at https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1429

Awesome job, [~kgill]! Some comments below...

I realized when UX reviewing this that we could be more helpful, with some help bubbles on the select certs dialog. I added two to the wireframe, for the private and public key labels. :)

I can't review the behavior when there is an existing cert on the cloud because there don't seem to be any. Can you put one on there so I can review this? I assume you've created some in development of this feature. Thanks!

When no existing certs, that widget and associated label should not display. Instead, we should A) replace that widget and label with text that says "No certificates are available. Please upload a new certificate instead."  B) Default the radio button to the other one. Updated wireframe.

I added some gobbeldygook on the back end certs and clicked add cert, and it didn't give me an error, and the "Select" link on the listener panel didn't update like it should. Can you look into this and see what's up? 

I pushed some minor text fixes to your feature branch, FYI. Might wanna pull. :)
[~jloza]: I've uploaded some SSL certs to 10.111.1.34 in the acct-02/admin acct
[~spark]: What is the API call to list the back-end certificates attached to an ELB?
[~kgill] If your question is about server certificates attached to ELB https/ssl listeners, the answer is IAM::ListServerCertificates.
[~kgill] The backend cert is in the policy that you created and the listener's policy_names list should include that policy.

Since the certs are uploaded via IAM, you'd list them via IAM: http://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/APIReference/API_ListServerCertificates.html
As is the general rule, security features like this (including secret keys and keypairs) don't let you read the full contents back once they are created, only refer to them by arn or name.

[~kgill] Ignore the previous comment. It's in the BackendServerDescriptions. For example:

<BackendServerDescriptions><member><InstancePort>443</InstancePort><PolicyNames><member>snakeauth</member></PolicyNames></member></BackendServerDescriptions>

[~dkavanagh] Yep that's true for SSL certificates attached to the listeners (that's the ssl termination at the loadbalancer), but here I believe [~kgill] is asking the backend server certificates that's to *verify* the certificates that people put into the web servers (https). The difference is that for the ssl termination, we upload both public and private key pair to IAM and for the backend authentication, we upload only the public key as an ELB's policy.

hi [~kgill], 

* You have the policy and cert default options in the listener panel reversed (see wireframe). It's the policy that will have a default, not the certs.  
* The labels are wrapping. I know [~dkavanagh] figured out a way to fix that padding issue so you don't have to have another column and have ridiculous indentation , maybe check in with him for ideas?
* When there's no available SSL cert, the radio button for the upload is not selected, and it should be, plz. 
* styling for selected certs in listener panel does not match wireframe. 
* back end cert added via dialog is not displaying in table, and table is pushing outside boundaries of container. also, the text when no cert has been selected does not match wireframe. Screenshot attached. 
* when two tabs, submit button text on dialog should reflect multiple certs. I just updated the wireframe for that, sorry I missed it. Also, the button should be disabled until all required fields have data (both tabs)

[~jloza]: GUI-1486 branch updated with latest fixes...

- You have the policy and cert default options in the listener panel reversed (see wireframe). It's the policy that will have a default, not the certs. [FIXED]
- The labels are wrapping. I know David Kavanagh figured out a way to fix that padding issue so you don't have to have another column and have ridiculous indentation , maybe check in with him for ideas? [FIXED by stacking labels]
- When there's no available SSL cert, the radio button for the upload is not selected, and it should be, plz. [FIXED]
- styling for selected certs in listener panel does not match wireframe. [FIXED, although the tag-like style looked better IMHO]
- back end cert added via dialog is not displaying in table, and table is pushing outside boundaries of container. also, the text when no cert has been selected does not match wireframe. Screenshot attached. [FIXED]
- when two tabs, submit button text on dialog should reflect multiple certs. I just updated the wireframe for that, sorry I missed it. [FIXED] 
- Also, the button should be disabled until all required fields have data (both tabs) [FIXED]

Nice job, [~kgill]! Definitely getting there, a few more small items... 

Policy and SSL cert are required, per AWS documentation. Those two labels should be marked required and the Add Listener button should be disabled until a policy and SSL cert have been selected, plz. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/elb-create-https-ssl-load-balancer.html

Stacked labels look awesome, but there seems to be a padding issue with the Certificate name label, the padding there between label and widget should match the others on the page (it's a hair too tight at the moment). This is probably a fix that can be made globally, maybe it's the required but no help bubble combo that's throwing it off?

In the table of added listeners, there's a <th> missing for SECURITY above Policy and Certificates. I tried adding it in for you but couldn't get the spacing right, due to the extra column for the delete button. Sorry!

Still not seeing back-end policy name in the table. I added one (see screenshot) and it's not in the table (see screenshot). 

I used gobbledygook for my back end cert. Can't we validate at least that the content for the widgets starts with the expected strings? What do you think?

I pushed a small text fix to your branch. Might want to pull!

Hi Sang-Min,

While that’s true, we don’t rely on the service in the console, though. We default to the latest one in the console, and don’t allow the user to not have one selected. They’ll never not have one selected.

Thx,

J.



From: "Park, Sang-Min" <sangmin.park@hp.com<mailto:sangmin.park@hp.com>>
Date: Wednesday, June 24, 2015 at 11:01 AM
To: "Jenny Loza (JIRA)" <jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net<mailto:jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net>>, Jenny Loza <jenny.loza@hp.com<mailto:jenny.loza@hp.com>>, "Gill, Kamal" <kamal.gill@hp.com<mailto:kamal.gill@hp.com>>
Cc: "spark@eucalyptus.com<mailto:spark@eucalyptus.com>" <spark@eucalyptus.com<mailto:spark@eucalyptus.com>>
Subject: Re: [JIRA] (GUI-1486) ELB - Support uploading SSL certificates


Policy is not required from the service side. If no policy is set, the service will use the latest one.
Sent using CloudMagic<https://cloudmagic.com/k/d/mailapp?ct=pi&cv=6.4.27&pv=8.3>

On Wed, Jun 24, 2015 at 8:40 AM, Jenny Loza (JIRA) <jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net<mailto:jira@eucalyptus.atlassian.net>> wrote:

[ https://eucalyptus.atlassian.net/browse/GUI-1486?page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:all-tabpanel ]

Jenny Loza updated GUI-1486:
----------------------------
Assignee: Kamal Gill (was: Jenny Loza)
Status: Confirmed (was: In Review)

Nice job, [~kgill]! Definitely getting there, a few more small items...

Policy and SSL cert are required, per AWS documentation. Those two labels should be marked required and the Add Listener button should be disabled until a policy and SSL cert have been selected, plz. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/elb-create-https-ssl-load-balancer.html

Stacked labels look awesome, but there seems to be a padding issue with the Certificate name label, the padding there between label and widget should match the others on the page (it's a hair too tight at the moment). This is probably a fix that can be made globally, maybe it's the required but no help bubble combo that's throwing it off?

In the table of added listeners, there's a <th> missing for SECURITY above Policy and Certificates. I tried adding it in for you but couldn't get the spacing right, due to the extra column for the delete button. Sorry!

Still not seeing back-end policy name in the table. I added one (see screenshot) and it's not in the table (see screenshot).

I used gobbledygook for my back end cert. Can't we validate at least that the content for the widgets starts with the expected strings? What do you think?

I pushed a small text fix to your branch. Might want to pull!




--
This message was sent by Atlassian JIRA
(v6.5-OD-07-005#65007)

[~jloza]: My comments are inline...

Policy and SSL cert are required, per AWS documentation. Those two labels should be marked required and the Add Listener button should be disabled until a policy and SSL cert have been selected, plz. http://docs.aws.amazon.com/ElasticLoadBalancing/latest/DeveloperGuide/elb-create-https-ssl-load-balancer.html [For the SSL cert stuff, the back-end certs are optional, assuming "Policy" refers to back-end policy here] [J.Lo: meant security policy, but since there's always one selected, no need for that one to be required. Certs one should show required and block availability of add button since SSL cert is required.]

Stacked labels look awesome, but there seems to be a padding issue with the Certificate name label, the padding there between label and widget should match the others on the page (it's a hair too tight at the moment). This is probably a fix that can be made globally, maybe it's the required but no help bubble combo that's throwing it off? [I'll take a look and fix it here or perhaps open a separate ticket if it's a global fix]

In the table of added listeners, there's a <th> missing for SECURITY above Policy and Certificates. I tried adding it in for you but couldn't get the spacing right, due to the extra column for the delete button. Sorry! [I added this in GUI-1621 a couple of days ago]

Still not seeing back-end policy name in the table. I added one (see screenshot) and it's not in the table (see screenshot). [The back-end policy is generated server-side after the form is submitted, so we won't see the back-end policy until after the changes are submitted] [J.Lo: That is going to be super confusing. We show the name in the listener panel but then not in the table? Why can't we show it in the table on the client side until the server side updates? This is not going to be a good thing for users. Let's discuss.]

I used gobbledygook for my back end cert. Can't we validate at least that the content for the widgets starts with the expected strings? What do you think? [ I'll see what we can do for the content-based validation, but perhaps we should open an improvement ticket for that?] [J.Lo: validation is generally not seen as an improvement, but rather as part of the initial feature implementation. If it's too much to do right now we can open a bug against it and you can work on that later, but it should definitely be a bug, not an improvement.]
[~kgill], I edited your above comment with inline comments, noted with "J.lo:"
Implemented the latest suggested fixes.  Back to you for review [~jloza]
margins above textareas are set to 4.8 but should be set to 0. Opened GUI-1848 to track and fix that globally for all console widgetry.

SO CLOSE, [~kgill]! 

Forgot to include help bubble on TH for Certificates like we discussed, so that users would know why they are back-end certs now and back-end policy later....see wireframe for deets. Can you also make one with an actual back-end policy saved in one of your ELBs so I can check the text for the later part? I don't have any to upload...
UX review passed, nice job [~kgill]. Ready for code review.
[~dkavanagh] can this ticket be moved to QA? PR was merged yesterday.
I was able to upload SSL certs from the GUI.
Released in 4.2
